awards.title: Awards
items: Associate Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (AFHEA), 2023
CodeJam to I/O for Women coding competition winner, 2019

items.title: Founder of IT Jobs KZ
items.description: Job board for IT specialists in Kazakhstan

items.title: Co-founder of DSML KZ
items.description: Community of data scientists in Kazakhstan with over 7,000 members

items.title: Advising CTO
description: Set technical vision and architected platform for real-time video processing and analytics for hazardous situations detection (physical aggression, injuries, fire/smoke, unauthorized people) and discipline monitoring (attendance tracking, school policies violations).
Led a cross-functional engineering team of ~10 specialists (ML, backend, frontend, DevOps, network & hardware engineering).
Pilot launch in two schools in Astana.

items.title: CTO (Dec 2024 - Jul 2025) | Head of AI/ML (Oct 2024 - Dec 2024)
description: As Head of AI/ML: Set up ML research workflows and built core CV systems (YOLO, keypoint interaction, face recognition) for event and action detection; validated feasibility through MVPs deployed in real school environments.
As CTO (Dec 2024 - Jul 2025): Led a cross-functional engineering team of ~25 specialists (ML, backend, frontend, mobile, UX/UI, DevOps).
Architected platform for real-time processing, alerting, and analytics in educational institutions.
Built the engineering organization from scratch; owned end-to-end hiring: sourcing, interviews, onboarding.

items.title: Head of AI/ML
description: Established company's ML/AI function, leading a team on innovative projects for the gaming industry:
• Anticheat system for Counter Strike 2 and CS:GO (computer vision based solutions for WallHack cheats and sophisticated deep learning and mathematical algorithms for AimBot, Spinbot type of cheats)
• Recommendation systems for content suggestions and gaming marketplace
• Match-making and ranking system for normal and custom modes of team playing in Counter Strike
Scaled the team from 2 to 5 senior ML engineers, overseeing the entire hiring process
Managed cross-team communication and stakeholder collaboration to ensure alignment, optimizing project delivery
Gaming platform that prevents cheating in multiplayer games, total raise of $17.8 million

items.title: Senior Lecturer
description: Designed and taught Electronics & Digital Design course for second year undergraduate students of Faculty of Information Technologies

items.title: Teaching Assistant
description: Taught Calculus (1st year students), Introduction to Python (2nd year students), Statistical Inference (3rd year students)

items.title: PhD in Machine Learning
items.institution: Mohammed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence
description: Relevant coursework: Advanced Continuous Optimization · Parallel and Distributed ML · Advanced Topics in Causality & ML
Member of BioMedIA and Causality research groups
Global top 20 across ML, CV, NLP (CSRankings), world's first AI university

items.title: MPhil. in Mathematical Sciences
description: Developed mathematical approaches to infer kinetics as a system of ODEs from catalytic reactions time-series data under the supervision of Prof. Stefan Güttel and Prof. Igor Larrosa
Numerical linear algebra group member
Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC) scholarship holder (full coverage of tuition fees and £17.667 of yearly stipend)
Ranked 34th in the world and 6th in the UK (QSRankings)

media.alt: Presenting research poster at NLH60 conference
media.caption: Poster session at NJH60: Advances in Numerical Linear Algebra, celebrating the 60th Birthday of Nick Higham

media.alt: Numerical Linear Algebra Group at the University of Manchester
media.caption: Member of the Numerical Linear Algebra (NLA) Group at the University of Manchester

items.title: MSc. in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: CGPA: 3.30 (out of 4.00)
Activities and societies: Member of "Stand Up! Night" stand up comedy club
Worked as a Research Assistant (RA) at Advanced Signal Processing Laboratory under the supervision of Prof. Muhammad Tahir Akhtar and Prof. Prashant Kumar Jamwal.
The research output was presented and published at four conferences across the globe (APSIPA ASC 2020, EMBC 2021, APSIPA ASC 2021, DSP 2023) and in Applied Sciences journal
Thesis: "Meta-Classification of Brain Signals in P300 Speller". Implementation of EEG features classification using deep learning models
Top-1 research university in Kazakhstan

media.alt: NU SEDS Hall of Fame poster
media.caption: Featured in Nazarbayev University's Hall of Fame

media.alt: Performing at Stand Up! Night concert
media.caption: Performing at Stand Up! Night concert with an audience of 600 people

items.title: BEng. in Automation and Control
description: CGPA: 3.68 (out of 4.00)
Activities and societies: President of FunLife student stand up comedy club

Coursework: Modeling and Identification of Control Object, Theory of Control, Sensors and Actuators, Microcontrollers, Microprocessors, Electronics, Algorithms and Data Structures, Object Oriented Programming, Low Level Programming, Computer Networks

Achievements: 
• Google I/O 2019 participant (Code Jam to I/O for Women top competitor)
• KBTU Success 2019 award holder 
• Winner of Hackathon 4.0: Data for future (by Unicef and Microsoft)
• Winner of "Digitalization of the ecosystem of health and social protection. Blockchain" hackathon by Unicef
ABET accredited university
